body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one):
bug report

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
kubectl , kubefed, kubeadm binary version: compiled from master today
kubectl version:
>\# ./kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"", Minor:"", GitVersion:"v0.0.0-master+$Format:%h$", GitCommit:"$Format:%H$", GitTreeState:"not a git tree", BuildDate:"1970-01-01T00:00:00Z", GoVersion:"go1.8rc3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6+", GitVersion:"v1.6.0-alpha.1", GitCommit:"424a0e9e827a39c714ee03e1891c43635adabcdc", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-01-31T02:31:32Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

my cluster is bootstrapped by kubeadm


**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: hardware
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): centOS 7.2 64bit
- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`): 
>\# uname -a
Linux vmwarecgsl5.localdomain 3.10.0-327.22.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Nov 4 01:46:03 CST 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

- **Install tools**:
- **Others**:


**What happened**:
when i ran `./kubefed  init brucetest --host-cluster-context=kubernetes-admin@kubernetes  --dns-zone-name=example.com --kubeconfig=/etc/kubernetes/admin.conf --image=gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.6.0-alpha.1 --api-server-service-type=NodePort --storage-backend=etcd3 --etcd-persistent-storage=false`, it exited with error message:
>error: context "brucetest" does not exist

**What you expected to happen**:

kubefed initialize a federation control plane successfully
title: kubefed init fails
